Package nl.uu.cs.aplib.multiAgentSupport

Class ComNode

java.lang.Object
nl.uu.cs.aplib.multiAgentSupport.ComNode
public class ComNode extends Object
This class provides a 'communication node' for agents. It provides a simple message routing between agents. To use it, agents first need to register themselves to a ComNode. The ComNode maintains an address book that maps agents' names to pointers to these agents. A plain nl.uu.cs.aplib.MainConcepts.BasicAgent has no method to register to ComNode. However, AutonomousBasicAgent can register to a ComNode, but keep in mind that an AutonomousBasicAgent can only be a member of at most one ComNode. Access to this ComNode is provided through its agent state.

When an agent A wants to send a message to agent B, A only needs to know B's name. A would then send the message to its ComNode, and the ComNode will take care that the message is delivered to B. Note that without a ComNode every agent will have to know the pointers to every other agents it needs to send messages to. Furthermore, a ComNode allows a convenient way for an agent to broadcast a message to all other agents (which are registered to the same ComNode), or to all other agents with the same role.

Author:
Wish

    • register

    • deregister

    • send

      public Acknowledgement send​(Message msg)
      This is invoked by an agent to send a message to other agent(s), depending on the message type. If the type is SINGLECAST this ComNode will forward it to its specified target agent (just one can be targetted in a SINGLECAST). If it is a BROADCAST the message will be forwarded to all agents registered to this ComNode. If it is a ROLECAST the message will be forwarded to all agents with the same role as the target role specified in the message.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to send.
      Returns:
      An Acknowledgement. It is a negative acknowledgement (REJECTED) if the message is a SINGLECAST and its target does not exists. In all other cases the acknowledgement should be positive (SUCCESS).
